title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 263.101 - Impasse arbitration; response and cross-response
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 263.101 - Impasse arbitration; response and cross-response

State Regulations
(a) Response. A response
shall be filed in the same manner as was the petition within 10 working days of
receipt of the petition requesting arbitration. A copy of the response shall
also be served simultaneously upon the petitioning party. (b) Contents of response. Such response shall contain respondent's position specifying the terms and
conditions of employment that were resolved by agreement, and as to those that
were not agreed upon, respondent shall set forth its position. Proposed
contract language presented during negotiations shall be included. If the
respondent has filed a declaratory ruling petition with the director of PEPR
related to neutral arbitration under section
263.107
of this Part, the response
shall contain a reference to such petition. The response must include proof of
service upon the petitioning party. (c) Cross-response. A
petitioner filing an objection to arbitrability under Section
263.107
of this Part, as a result
of the response, must file a cross-response notifying the director of
conciliation of such filing. Such cross-response shall be filed within ten
working days of receipt of the response. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
263.101

Adopted

New

York State Register February 15, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 07, eff. 2/15/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
